LOTlib.Primitives.Number module¶

LOTlib.Primitives.Primitives module¶

LOTlib.Primitives.Primitives.LOTlib_primitive(fn)¶
LOTlib.Primitives.Primitives.None2None(fn)¶

A decorator to map anything with “None” as a list arg (NOT a keyword arg) this will make it return None overall

If you want to have this not prevent incrementing (via LOTlib_primitive), then we need to put it after LOTlib_primitive:

@None2None def f(...):

LOTlib.Primitives.Trees module¶

LOTlib.Primitives.Trees.ancestors(T, x)¶

Here is a version of ancestors that is O(n), rather than the repeated calls to tree_up, which is O(N^2)

LOTlib.Primitives.Trees.co_refers(x, y)¶
LOTlib.Primitives.Trees.immediately_dominates(x, y)¶
LOTlib.Primitives.Trees.is_nonterminal_type(x, y)¶
LOTlib.Primitives.Trees.tree_up(T, x)¶

Go up one node in the tree. If you are root, return None

NOTE: Super slow since we search over the whole tree each time.... This is a little tricky otherwise without pointers
